hero.title: Professional Simulators & Smart Devices for Virtual Reality
hero.description: We create functional physical replicas for VR/AR training — weapons, tools, technical equipment and custom devices. UnicTava develops complete simulators — hardware + software — designed for full integration with Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality experiences.
hero.description2: We build realistic physical replicas (3D-printed or technically modeled), equipped with electronic sensors, triggers, buttons, vibration systems, microcontrollers and precise calibration for professional training. We develop simulators for any purpose: security forces, police training, industrial and technical maintenance, machine operation, technical education, corporate environments, risk simulators, military training, emergency scenarios. If a client needs a physical device connected to VR, we build it.

whatItDoes.title: What We Develop
whatItDoes.item4Text: Simulators are ideal when the user must:
item4List: Feel the real tool in their hands
Use tools that cannot be handled in real life

advantages.title: Client Benefits
advantages.item1Text: Physical interaction increases immersion and prepares users for real-world situations.
advantages.item2Text: Train dangerous scenarios without real risk.
advantages.item3Text: The physical device is perfectly aligned with the virtual object — aim, movement, firing and interaction.
advantages.item4Text: We design the simulator exactly as the client needs.
advantages.item5Text: Works with any modern VR system.
advantages.item6Text: Usage data, accuracy, errors, reaction time and full stats can be recorded.
advantages.item7Text: New parts, modules or features can be added easily.

technologies.title: Technologies Used
technologies.item1Text: We use professional high-resolution 3D printers to create realistic and durable physical replicas, ensuring dimensional accuracy and industrial-grade technical finish.
technologies.item2Text: We work with engineering polymers, technical resins and composite materials that guarantee strength, durability and appropriate weight for intensive professional use.
technologies.item3Text: We integrate custom electronic boards, power systems, connectors and circuits designed specifically for each simulator, with proper protection and insulation.
technologies.item4Text: We program microcontrollers (Arduino, ESP32, STM32) to manage sensors, buttons, triggers and wireless communication with the VR system in real-time.
technologies.item5Text: We implement Hall sensors, force sensors, tactical buttons and precision switches to detect movement, pressure, position and activation with high sensitivity.
technologies.item6Text: We integrate vibration motors, haptic actuators and tactile feedback systems to simulate weapon recoil, impacts, textures and realistic physical sensations.
technologies.item7Text: We develop automatic calibration routines that adjust sensors, position, aim and synchronization with the VR environment, ensuring constant precision without manual adjustments.
technologies.item8Text: We create custom firmware for each device, with optimized control logic, Bluetooth/WiFi communication, power management and remote updates when needed.

projects.item2Text: Built with special sensors, safety functions and full integration with police training environments.
projects.item3Text: Replica with multiple sensors, reinforced structure and connectivity for tactical training.
projects.item4Text: Built for technical maintenance education with sensor reading and haptic feedback.

testimonials.item2Text: The integration of AR in our construction sites greatly facilitated project planning and execution. The precision and interactivity of AR solutions were a real game-changer.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.question1: How long does it take to create a VR/AR project?
faq.answer1: 15 days to 4 months, depending on complexity.
faq.question2: Does it work with any headset?
faq.answer2: Yes — Meta, Pico, HTC Vive, Varjo, Valve Index and all OpenXR-compatible headsets.
faq.question4: Can I add new modules later?
faq.answer5: Yes — simulated weapons, buttons, ESP32 and custom devices.
faq.question7: Can it be used on PC without a headset?

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.content: This website collects personal data (name, email, phone) provided voluntarily by users through the quote form. Protecting your data is a priority for us, and this document explains how we handle your information.

section2.title: 2. Data Controller
section2.content: The controller responsible for the processing of personal data collected on this website is Rafael Tavares / UnicTava, headquartered at Via Montefeltro, 8/10, 20156 Milano MI, Italia.

section3.title: 3. Data Collected
section3.content: We collect the following information when you fill out our contact or quote form: Full name, Email address, Phone number (when voluntarily provided), Project type of interest, Message and project details, Attached files (when provided).

section4.title: 4. Purpose of Processing
section4.content: The collected data is used exclusively to respond to your quote and contact requests. We do not share your information with third parties without your explicit authorization, except when required by law.

section5.title: 5. Legal Basis and Storage
section5.content: The legal basis for processing your data is the explicit consent provided by checking the acceptance box on the form. Data is stored securely on our servers (Supabase) and kept only for the time necessary to fulfill the purpose for which it was collected, generally up to 12 months.

section6.title: 6. User Rights
section6.intro: You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
section6.right1: Right of Access: request a copy of the data we hold about you
section6.right2: Right of Rectification: correct incorrect or incomplete data
section6.right3: Right to Erasure: request the deletion of your data
section6.right4: Right to Portability: receive your data in a structured format
section6.right5: Right to Lodge a Complaint: file a complaint with the competent data protection authority (Garante per la Protezione dei Dati Personali - Italy)

section7.title: 7. Retention Period
section7.content: Personal data will be kept for the time strictly necessary to achieve the purposes for which it was collected. After this period, the data will be deleted or anonymized. In general, we keep contact data for up to 12 months from the last interaction.

section8.title: 8. Data Security
section8.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, loss, destruction, or alteration. However, no Internet transmission is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

section9.title: 9. Contact for Privacy Matters
section9.content: To exercise your rights or clarify questions about the processing of your personal data, contact us via email:

cookiePolicy.metaDescription: UnicTava Cookie Policy - Understand how we use cookies to improve your website experience
cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy

section1.title: 1. What are Cookies
section1.content: Cookies are small text files that websites store on your device when you visit them. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and to provide information to website owners.

section2.title: 2. Technical Cookies (Always Active)
section2.intro: These cookies are essential for the basic functioning of the website and do not require your prior consent:

cookie1.name: Session Cookie
cookie1.description: Keeps your session active while you browse the website. Expires when you close your browser.

cookie2.name: Language Preference Cookie
cookie2.description: Stores your language preference (Portuguese, English, or Italian). Duration: 12 months.

cookie3.name: Consent Cookie
cookie3.description: Records your cookie choices. Duration: 12 months.

section3.title: 3. Analytics Cookies (Optional)
section3.intro: These cookies help us understand how visitors use the website, always anonymously. They require your consent:

cookie1.name: Google Analytics (_ga, _ga_*)
cookie1.description: Used to collect information about how visitors use our website. We use this information to compile reports and help us improve the website. The cookies collect information anonymously. Duration: 2 years.

cookie2.name: Third-party Cookies
cookie2.description: We may use third-party cookies for traffic analysis and user behavior.

section3.note: Important: According to Italian regulations (Garante per la Protezione dei Dati Personali), analytics and third-party cookies can only be activated after your explicit consent.

section4.title: 4. Cookie Management
section4.content1: When you access this website for the first time, you will see a consent banner where you can choose which cookie categories to accept. You can change your preferences at any time by clicking the 'Cookie Settings' link in the website footer.
section4.content2: You can also manage cookies directly in your browser settings. Consult your browser's help section for instructions on how to block or delete cookies.

section5.title: 5. Legal Basis
section5.content: As established by the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the guidelines of the Italian Garante, we obtain your explicit consent before activating non-essential cookies. Your consent is valid for 12 months, after which we will request it again.

section6.title: 6. Duration and Renewal
section6.content: Cookie consent is valid for 12 months. After this period, we will request your consent again through the cookie banner.

section7.title: 7. Contact
section7.content: For questions about our cookie policy and your choices, contact us via email:
